text: 100% they have tried to live with less
it's not easy it's great
it is called the largest convergence of
humanity on the planet millions of
worshipers have descended on the
northern Indian city of Allahabad for
this year's Maha Camilla a Hindu
festival which happens every hundred and
forty four years the proceedings revolve
around bathing in the sacred Ganges and
Yamuna rivers which converge in a lava
at the centre of much of the religious
activity is the sadhu sadhu means simple
noble humble dedicated committed to the
divine and to his creation live with
less because life is not to have more
life is to be more their journey is from
having more to being more sorrows are
usually present at Hindu ceremonies and
festivals draped in saffron robes or are
often naked with unkempt beards some
estimates show that there are 200,000
sadhus at the Maha Camela on
particularly auspicious bathing days
during the 55 Day Festival alli and I
became a sadhu out of devotion and also
to protect our ancient hindu dharma
principles and values from being
destroyed there are many different types
of sadhus among the most dramatic and
fiercest looking are Naga sadhus like
rajendran and Saraswathi who smear their
entire bodies in ash and are wearing
only prayer beads pilgrims seek out
siddhu's and pay them for religious
blessings during the festival
when our devotees come to us bless them
with the sacred ash and give them food
to offer to God
not without your attire Naga Sadow's
usually live in austere communes
separated from modern society soft with
what everyone's have everyone can't
become assad if you have a family you
can't they would not be proper for you
in India sadhus are viewed with both
reverence and suspicion partly because
they are often seen smoking marijuana as
part of their religious practice by
smoking marijuana the mind is at peace
you find bliss and singing God's name it
will save the mine from distractions and
from making mistakes do you understand
marijuana use is illegal in India but
police turn a blind eye and so do other
Hindu religious leaders I don't know
what in that intoxication but not other
things I have entered that I'm not aware
of it but the main thing was
intoxication of the divine take his name
offer your life to him and then threw
him in the service of humanity that is
to me is more important while the
festivities of the mahakal mela and
March 10th the sadhus will continue with
their practice of these ancient rituals
look at that faith no fear no worry
where to sleep where to go what to wear
just one thought having the depth and
being free
